speaker: GOWER
text: How now, Captain Fluellen? Come you from

speaker: GOWER
text: the bridge?

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: I assure you there is very excellent services

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: committed at the bridge.

speaker: GOWER
text: Is the Duke of Exeter safe?

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: The Duke of Exeter is as magnanimous as

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: Agamemnon, and a man that I love and honor with

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: my soul and my heart and my duty and my life and

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: my living and my uttermost power. He is not, God

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: be praised and blessed, any hurt in the world, but

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: keeps the bridge most valiantly, with excellent

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: discipline. There is an aunchient lieutenant there at

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: the pridge; I think in my very conscience he is as

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: valiant a man as Mark Antony, and he is a man of no

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: estimation in the world, but I did see him do as

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: gallant service.

speaker: GOWER
text: What do you call him?

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: He is called Aunchient Pistol.

speaker: GOWER
text: I know him not.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: Here is the man.

speaker: PISTOL
text: Captain, I thee beseech to do me favors. The

speaker: PISTOL
text: Duke of Exeter doth love thee well.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: Ay, I praise God, and I have merited some

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: love at his hands.

speaker: PISTOL
text: Bardolph, a soldier firm and sound of heart and

speaker: PISTOL
text: of buxom valor, hath, by cruel Fate and giddy

speaker: PISTOL
text: Fortune’s furious fickle wheel, that goddess blind,

speaker: PISTOL
text: that stands upon the rolling restless stone—

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: By your patience, Aunchient Pistol, Fortune

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: is painted blind, with a muffler afore her eyes, to

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: signify to you that Fortune is blind; and she is

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: painted also with a wheel to signify to you, which is

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: the moral of it, that she is turning and inconstant,

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: and mutability and variation; and her foot, look you,

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: is fixed upon a spherical stone, which rolls and rolls

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: and rolls. In good truth, the poet makes a most

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: excellent description of it. Fortune is an excellent

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: moral.

speaker: PISTOL
text: Fortune is Bardolph’s foe and frowns on him,

speaker: PISTOL
text: for he hath stolen a pax and hangèd must he be. A

speaker: PISTOL
text: damnèd death! Let gallows gape for dog, let man go

speaker: PISTOL
text: free, and let not hemp his windpipe suffocate. But

speaker: PISTOL
text: Exeter hath given the doom of death for pax of little

speaker: PISTOL
text: price. Therefore go speak; the Duke will hear thy

speaker: PISTOL
text: voice, and let not Bardolph’s vital thread be cut

speaker: PISTOL
text: with edge of penny cord and vile reproach. Speak,

speaker: PISTOL
text: captain, for his life, and I will thee requite.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: Aunchient Pistol, I do partly understand

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: your meaning.

speaker: PISTOL
text: Why then, rejoice therefore.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: Certainly, aunchient, it is not a thing to

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: rejoice at, for if, look you, he were my brother, I

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: would desire the Duke to use his good pleasure and

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: put him to execution, for discipline ought to be

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: used.

speaker: PISTOL
text: Die and be damned, and figo for thy friendship!

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: It is well.

speaker: PISTOL
text: The fig of Spain!

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: Very good.

speaker: GOWER
text: Why, this is an arrant counterfeit rascal. I

speaker: GOWER
text: remember him now, a bawd, a cutpurse.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: I’ll assure you he uttered as prave words at

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: the pridge as you shall see in a summer’s day. But it

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: is very well; what he has spoke to me, that is well, I

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: warrant you, when time is serve.

speaker: GOWER
text: Why, ’tis a gull, a fool, a rogue, that now and

speaker: GOWER
text: then goes to the wars to grace himself at his return

speaker: GOWER
text: into London under the form of a soldier; and such

speaker: GOWER
text: fellows are perfect in the great commanders’

speaker: GOWER
text: names, and they will learn you by rote where

speaker: GOWER
text: services were done—at such and such a sconce, at

speaker: GOWER
text: such a breach, at such a convoy; who came off

speaker: GOWER
text: bravely, who was shot, who disgraced, what terms

speaker: GOWER
text: the enemy stood on; and this they con perfectly in

speaker: GOWER
text: the phrase of war, which they trick up with new-tuned

speaker: GOWER
text: oaths; and what a beard of the general’s cut

speaker: GOWER
text: and a horrid suit of the camp will do among

speaker: GOWER
text: foaming bottles and ale-washed wits is wonderful to

speaker: GOWER
text: be thought on. But you must learn to know such

speaker: GOWER
text: slanders of the age, or else you may be marvelously

speaker: GOWER
text: mistook.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: I tell you what, Captain Gower. I do perceive

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: he is not the man that he would gladly make

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: show to the world he is. If I find a hole in his coat, I

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: will tell him my mind.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: Hark you, the King is coming, and I must speak

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: with him from the pridge.—God pless your

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: Majesty.

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: How now, Fluellen, cam’st thou from the

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: bridge?

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: Ay, so please your Majesty. The Duke of

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: Exeter has very gallantly maintained the pridge.

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: The French is gone off, look you, and there is gallant

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: and most prave passages. Marry, th’ athversary was

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: have possession of the pridge, but he is enforced

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: to retire, and the Duke of Exeter is master of the

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: pridge. I can tell your Majesty, the Duke is a prave

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: man.

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: What men have you lost, Fluellen?

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: The perdition of th’ athversary hath been

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: very great, reasonable great. Marry, for my part, I

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: think the Duke hath lost never a man but one that is

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: like to be executed for robbing a church, one

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: Bardolph, if your Majesty know the man. His face is

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: all bubukles and whelks and knobs and flames o’

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: fire; and his lips blows at his nose, and it is like a

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: coal of fire, sometimes plue and sometimes red, but

speaker: FLUELLEN
text: his nose is executed, and his fire’s out.

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: We would have all such offenders so cut

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: off; and we give express charge that in our marches

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: through the country there be nothing compelled

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: from the villages, nothing taken but paid for,

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: none of the French upbraided or abused in disdainful

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: language; for when lenity and cruelty play

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: for a kingdom, the gentler gamester is the soonest

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: winner.

speaker: MONTJOY
text: You know me by my habit.

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: Well then, I know thee. What shall I know

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: of thee?

speaker: MONTJOY
text: My master’s mind.

speaker:
KING
               
              HENRY
text: Unfold it.

speaker: MONTJOY
text: Thus says my king: “Say thou to Harry of

speaker: MONTJOY
text: England, though we seemed dead, we did but sleep.

speaker: MONTJOY
text: Advantage is a better soldier than rashness. Tell him

speaker: MONTJOY
text: we could have rebuked him at Harfleur, but that we

speaker: MONTJOY
text: thought not good to bruise an injury till it were full

speaker: MONTJOY
text: ripe. Now we speak upon our cue, and our voice is

speaker: MONTJOY
text: imperial. England shall repent his folly, see his

speaker: MONTJOY
text: weakness, and admire our sufferance. Bid him

speaker: MONTJOY
text: therefore consider of his ransom, which must proportion

speaker: MONTJOY
text: the losses we have borne, the subjects we

speaker: MONTJOY
text: have lost, the disgrace we have digested, which, in

speaker: MONTJOY
text: weight to reanswer, his pettiness would bow under.

speaker: MONTJOY
text: For our losses, his exchequer is too poor; for th’

speaker: MONTJOY
text: effusion of our blood, the muster of his kingdom

speaker: MONTJOY
text: too faint a number; and for our disgrace, his own

speaker: MONTJOY
text: person kneeling at our feet but a weak and worthless

speaker: MONTJOY
text: satisfaction. To this, add defiance, and tell him,

speaker: MONTJOY
text: for conclusion, he hath betrayed his followers,

speaker: MONTJOY
text: whose condemnation is pronounced.” So far my

speaker: MONTJOY
text: king and master; so much my office.

What
               
              is

              .

Montjoy
              .

Thou
               
              dost
               
              thy

              fairly
              .

              ,

Without

Unto

Almost

I

Did

That

Hath
